summary: This is a superseding indictment filed in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with five counts related to the sexual exploitation and abuse of multiple minor girls, including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, enticement, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and sex trafficking conspiracy. The document details Maxwell's role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of victims as young as 14, and her subsequent perjury in a 2016 deposition. This is a superseding indictment filed in the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell, detailing charges of conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, sex trafficking of a minor, and perjury. It includes specific overt acts involving a minor victim (Minor Victim-4) and excerpts from Maxwell's 2016 deposition testimony.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant charged with multiple counts related to conspiring with and facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls. The indictment details her intimate and professional relationship with Epstein, her role in grooming victims, and her perjury in 2016.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financier who sexually abused minor girls. The indictment describes him as the primary perpetrator, with Maxwell assisting in his abuse. He is named as a co-conspirator in multiple counts.

persons.name: Minor Victim-4
persons.context: An underage girl recruited between 2001-2004 to engage in sex acts with Epstein at his Palm Beach residence, and who was encouraged to recruit other girls.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney who signed the indictment as the foreperson.

connections.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to entice, transport, and traffic minor girls for sexual abuse. They had an intimate relationship from approximately 1994-1997 and a professional relationship where Maxwell was paid to manage Epstein's properties.
Between approximately 1994 and 2004, Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties.
Maxwell recruited, enticed, and scheduled appointments for Minor Victim-4 to engage in paid sex acts with Epstein.
Epstein engaged in sex acts with Minor Victim-4 at his Palm Beach residence and provided her with cash payments.

events.title: Beginning of Conspiracy and Abuse
events.description: The indictment alleges the conspiracy and abuse of minor girls by Maxwell and Epstein began at least in or about 1994.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-1
events.description: Maxwell groomed and participated in the sexual abuse of Minor Victim-1, who was approximately 14 when they met. Abuse occurred in New York and Florida, including group sexual encounters.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell interacted with Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico ranch, took her shopping and to a movie, and provided her with an unsolicited topless massage as part of grooming.

events.title: Grooming and Abuse of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged her to massage him, knowing it would lead to sexual abuse.

events.title: Sex Trafficking of Minor Victim-4
events.description: Maxwell met, groomed, and facilitated the abuse of Minor Victim-4 (approx. 14 years old) at Epstein's Palm Beach residence. This involved scheduling paid massage appointments, paying cash, and encouraging the victim to recruit other girls.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: In the context of civil litigation, Maxwell repeatedly provided false and perjurious statements under oath regarding her role in facilitating Epstein's abuse of minors.

events.title: Recruitment and Abuse of Minor Victim-4
events.description: Epstein and Maxwell recruited Minor Victim-4 to engage in sex acts with Epstein at his Palm Beach residence, paid her hundreds of dollars per encounter, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.

events.title: Gift Sent to Minor Victim-4
events.description: Epstein caused a package (including lingerie) to be sent via Federal Express from Manhattan to Minor Victim-4's residence in Florida.

events.title: Scheduling of Massage Appointments
events.description: An employee of Epstein's called Minor Victim-4 to schedule appointments for her to massage Epstein.

events.title: Maxwell's First Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell falsely testified she was unaware of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls and could not recall interacting with anyone under 18 at Epstein's properties other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell falsely testified she was unaware of sex toys at Epstein's Palm Beach house, unaware Epstein had sexual activities with others besides her and two other women, and that she never gave anyone a massage.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Residence)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the case)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with five federal counts: conspiracy to entice minors, enticement, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and sex trafficking conspiracy.

The indictment alleges Maxwell played a central role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the sexual abuse of at least four minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1 through -4) for Jeffrey Epstein from approximately 1994 to 2004.
Maxwell and Epstein created a network of underage victims, paying some victims to recruit other girls for Epstein to abuse.
Maxwell lied under oath during a 2016 deposition in civil litigation about her role in Epstein's abuse scheme.
The abuse and grooming occurred at multiple Epstein-owned properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and at Maxwell's residence in London.
The indictment charges Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy, sex trafficking of a minor, and two counts of perjury related to her 2016 deposition testimony.
Specific overt acts detail the recruitment and abuse of 'Minor Victim-4' between 2001-2004, including cash payments and encouragement to recruit other girls.
The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein sent gifts, including lingerie, from New York to Minor Victim-4 in Florida.
Maxwell's perjury charges are based on her denial of knowledge about Epstein's scheme, her interactions with minors, awareness of sex toys, and whether she gave massages.
The document includes forfeiture allegations for property used in or derived from the sex trafficking offense.
